thread.title: Things to do in Chicago this weekend - White Sox Fest, restaurant week, and more | FOX 32 Chicago
thread.title_full: Things to do in Chicago this weekend - White Sox Fest, restaurant week, and more | FOX 32 Chicago

author: Justine Baker
title: Things to do in Chicago this weekend - White Sox Fest, restaurant week, and more | FOX 32 Chicago
text:
Chicago - The weekend has arrived and Chicago is buzzing with events. Check out the newly revamped SoxFest Live , or excite your taste buds at one of the nearly 500 eateries taking part in Chicago's Restaurant Week . Here's a look at 11 things to do in the Windy City this weekend.
What concerts are in Chicago this weekend? Jan. 25: L'Imperatrice at Byline Bank Aragon Ballroom
Jan. 25: Moonglade at The Salt Shed Indoors
Jan 25: DJ Seinfeld at Concord Music Hall
Jan 26: Meshell Ndegeocello at Thalia Hall
What shows are in Chicago this weekend? Come From Away Set in the week following the September 11 attacks, the show tells the true tale of 7,000 stranded passengers and the small town in Newfoundland that welcomed them. With its powerful message of community and kindness, the Tony Award-winning musical is a must-see for theatergoers.
Disney on Ice Featuring favorite characters from classics like Frozen , The Little Mermaid , and Toy Story , Disney on Ice is an enchanting outing for both children and adults alike.
DeRay Davis Comedian Deray Davis is set to bring his sharp wit and infectious humor to the Chicago Improv Jan. 23 â€“ Jan 26. Ticket prices start at $50 and more information can be found online.
Pat McGann Chicago-native Pat McGann is returning home for a live show at the Chicago Theatre this Saturday. Tickets start at $36 and more information can be found online.
What other events are in Chicago this weekend? SoxFest Live SoxFest Live is this weekend at the Ramova Theatre, offering fans an opportunity to celebrate their favorite team with meet-and-greets, interactive panels, and a behind-the-scenes look at the White Sox organization. The newly revamped event will run Friday and Saturday from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m with tickets starting at $56.
Chicago Polar Bear Plunge The time has come for the 23rd annual Polar Plunge at Oak Street Beach. Since 2001, The Chicago Polar Bear Club has brought together thousands of people to raise money for Chicago-area families. This year's plunge is officially sold out, but spectators are still encouraged to come and support. Learn more at chicagopolarbearclub.com .
Chicago Restaurant Week This eagerly anticipated culinary event showcases the city's vibrant dining scene, offering food enthusiasts a chance to explore diverse cuisines. Participating restaurants across Chicago present prix fixed menus with brunch and lunch for $30, and dinner options starting at $45. Find the full list of nearly 500 local restaurants here .
